intro: Plagiobothrys bracteatus var. aculeolatus, commonly known as the hooked bract plagiobothrys, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces distinctive, hooked bracts that enclose its flowers. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. This variety is part of the Hydrophyllaceae family, which includes other flowering plants adapted to arid environments.
